medical_history.chief_complaint: One day onset of nausea after a fatty meal and right upper quadrant pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began one day prior to presentation, with nausea following a fatty meal and intermittent right upper quadrant pain. Associated symptoms include chills. The patient denies vomiting, fever, and chest pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of diverticulitis treated medically, GERD status post EGD with negative biopsies, hypothyroidism post iodine ablation of thyroid nodule, history of mastitis, and cholelithiasis under monitoring.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of diverticulitis; mother and sister both had gallstones; father died from complications of a cerebrovascular accident.
